alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:18PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Umatilla, southeastern Walla Walla and southwestern Columbia Counties through 845 PM PDT... At 818 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Walla Walla, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dixie, Ski Bluewood and Kooskooskie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
